WorkItem.Description:
Hello everyone
 
When maximizing a ribbonwindow or other window, the icon and the title would normally be placed lower when the window is maximized.
This doesn't happen with the ribbonwindow. To see this, maximize a ribbonwindow, for example one of the samples and compare it to al normal window.
 
Thank you.
WorkItem.Summary: Icon, title and qatoolbar are outlined uncorrectly when a ribbonwindow is maximized.

Comments.Message: Thanks for pointing out the issue. We will resolve it soon.
I tested this with the October 2010 release of the ribbon and it is still broken for the title of the window.

I got the latest version linked from MS's download site.  When using a background in tandem with the RibbonWindow it still draws up into the title bar, sometimes rendering over the maximize/minimize/close window buttons (though those can still be clicked on).  I'm attaching a screenshot of it.  All the window is doing is putting a gradient background in Grid.Background and then changing WindowState.

This is still an issue for us as well. We will work on getting this fixed some time in future, perhaps our next release. Thanks for letting us know!

-Troy at Microsoft
